messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: NASA is now working to find and record some of the smaller asteroids, which are large rocks that travel through space, especially those that are 140 metres wide or more. Scientists believe there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size, but so far they have only found about 8,000, which means 17,000 have not been found yet. These middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter the area around the Earth, because a much smaller 19-metre asteroid exploded above a city in Russia in 2013 and injured 1,200 people.

metadata.feedback_text: The submission is an instant FAIL. The primary reason is a violation of the CEFR Compliance Check. The target CEFR level was B1, but the submitted text was classified as B2. This is a non-negotiable failure condition according to the evaluation protocol.
